data.title: Prince Andrew embroiled in Chinese ‘spy’ flap
data.description: LONDON - A Chinese businessman who had forged close links with Prince Andrew and was authorised to act on his behalf to seek investors in China has been banned from Britain on national security grounds.

data.title: Six rare giant catfish surface in Cambodia
data.description: PHNOM PENH — Conservationists in Cambodia on Friday celebrated the discovery of six highly endangered Mekong giant catfish in the critical Southeast Asian waterway plagued by illegal fishing, habitat loss and plastic waste.

data.title: South Korean president faces second impeachment vote
data.description: SEOUL — South Korean lawmakers vote Saturday on whether to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law bid, in a second parliamentary showdown that remains too close to call.

data.title: Consultants pay $650m to settle US opioid case
data.description: BOSTON - The multinational consulting firm McKinsey & Co has agreed to pay $650 million to resolve a US criminal investigation into its work advising the opioid manufacturer Purdue Pharma on how to boost sales.

data.title: Kremlin applauds Trump’s Ukraine comments
data.description: MOSCOW - The Kremlin praised US President-elect Donald Trump on Friday for criticising Ukrainian missile strikes deep into Russian territory but said discussions about deploying European troops to keep a possible future peace in Ukraine were premature.

data.title: Korean lawmakers try again to impeach president
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung said on Friday the best way to restore order in the country is to impeach President  Yoon Suk Yeol , a day ahead of second planned parliamentary vote over Yoon’s short-lived imposition of martial law.

data.title: Huge illegal drug lab exposed in Syria
data.description: DOUMA - The industrial-scale drug lab sat just up a hill from a main road on the western edge of Damascus, the city that was the seat of power for the Assad family which long denied any links to the narcotics trade.

data.title: Switzerland plans revamp of Cold War-era nuclear bunker network
data.description: GOLLION, Switzerland - Switzerland wants to update its network of ageing nuclear shelters, which are increasingly seen as an asset at a time of greater global uncertainty, notably since Russia

data.title: US warship makes rare visit to Cambodia base at centre of feud
data.description: The US will send a warship to visit a naval base in Cambodia for the first time since the Southeast Asian nation reportedly signed a deal in 2019 that would allow China to establish a permanent foothold there.

data.title: Chinese student loses over B2.3m to Hong Kong scammers who told her to go to Thailand
data.description: A master

data.title: Filipina on Indonesia death row says planned transfer 'miracle'
data.description: A Filipina drug convict on death row in Indonesia told AFP from prison Friday that her planned transfer was a "miracle", in her first interview since Manila and Jakarta signed an agreement last week to repatriate her.

data.title: In authoritarian echo, Indonesia president suggests scrapping regional elections
data.description: JAKARTA - Indonesia

data.title: China says Philippines has 'provoked trouble' in S.China Sea with US backing
data.description: BEIJING - China accused the Philippines on Friday of having "provoked trouble" in the South China Sea with US backing, a week after Beijing and Manila traded accusations over a new confrontation in the disputed waters.

data.title: Taiwan says China's threat towards island has been evolving
data.description: TAIPEI - Taiwan

data.title: US police investigate ‘Wanted’ posters of executives
data.description: The New York Police Department is investigating a number of “Wanted” posters featuring senior executives that have been displayed in parts of Manhattan.

data.title: Time names Trump ‘Person of the Year’
data.description: Time magazine has named US President-elect  Donald Trump  its Person of the Year.

data.title: Hopes rise for giant catfish revival in Cambodia
data.description: The catching of six rare  giant catfish  in  Cambodia  in the space of five days, some weighing more than 120 kilogrammes, has raised hopes of a revival of a critically endangered species that is among the world’s largest freshwater fish.

data.title: Japan criminalises cannabis use as revised laws take effect
data.description: TOKYO - Japan started criminalising the use of cannabis and tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), a psychoactive chemical found in the plant, as revised laws took effect on Thursday amid growing concerns over drug abuse by young people.

data.title: South Korea's Yoon vows to fight 'until the very last minute'
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Thursday vowed to fight "until the very last minute" in a defiant address defending his shock decision last week to declare martial law and deploy troops to the country

data.title: Philippine VP doubts she will survive impeachment
data.description: MANILA - Philippine Vice President  Sara Duterte  expressed doubts on Wednesday about getting enough support from legislators to fight  impeachment  complaints filed against her, saying the process is a “political activity”.

data.title: Hong Kong targets EV transition for franchised buses, taxis in B2.6bn push
data.description: Hong Kong authorities will dish out more than HK$600 million (2.6 billion baht) to help franchised bus companies and the taxi industry procure electric vehicles (EVs) under a plan to achieve zero vehicular emissions and carbon neutrality by 2050.

data.title: S. Korean ex-defence minister tried to kill himself
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea
